sentences: Arild Nyquist (6 March 1937 – 21 December 2004) was a Norwegian novelist, poet, writer of children's books and musician.
He was born in Oslo, the son of Arild Otto Nyquist (1911–74) and  Gerd Nyquist (1913-84).
He was employed as a formation teacher at a primary school at Stamsund in Lofoten (1968-1976).
In 1960, he married   Anne-Kari Mosebekk, daughter of artist  Olav Mosebekk  (1910- 2001).
He made his literary debut in 1963 with the novel Ringer i et sommervann.
Nyquist was awarded Mads Wiel Nygaards Endowment in 1971.
He was nominated for the Nordic Council's Literature Prize in 1994 for the self-biographic novel Ungdom.
